title: Newton's Law of Cooling
text:
The temperature of an object, T, in surrounding air with temperature $$T_s$$ will behave according to the formula $$T(t)=A e^{k t}+T_s$$ where
$$t$$ is time,
A is the difference between the initial temperature of the object and the surroundings,
k is a constant, the continuous rate of cooling of the object.
speech:
The temperature of an object, T, in surrounding air with temperature    t sub s  will behave according to the formula    t of t is equal to   a, e raised to the k t power plus   t sub s  where
 t  is time,
A is the difference between the initial temperature of the object and the surroundings,
k is a constant, the continuous rate of cooling of the object.

title: Continuous rate of Cooling, k
text: It was given that after $$15$$ minutes, the internal temperature was 95° F. Substitute these values into the expression, along with A and $$T_s$$ that was previously found. What is k? Round to six decimal places.
